{{Distinguish|Central Park Towers}} {{Infobox building | name = Central Park Tower | image = File:CentralParkTowerNov2.jpg | caption = Central Park Tower under construction on November 2, 2018. | location = 225 West 57th Street
[[Manhattan]], [[New York City]], [[New York (state)|New York]], [[United States|U.S.]] | coordinates = {{coord|40.76590|-73.98089|type:landmark_globe:earth_region:US-NY|display=inline,title}} | status = Under construction | start_date = 2014 | completion_date = 2020 (Scheduled){{cite news|author=Amy Plitt|url=https://ny.curbed.com/2017/6/1/15714666/central-park-tower-offering-plan-approval-sales-launch|title=Central Park Tower is now one step closer to launching sales|date=1 June 2017|access-date=30 August 2017|work=Curbed}} | building_type = [[Residential]], retail [[office]] [[hotel]] | architectural = {{convert|1550|ft|0|adj=mid}} | top_floor = | floor_count = 130https://newyorkyimby.com/2018/09/central-park-tower-climbs-past-1100-feet-as-cladding-and-glass-begin-to-show.html (95 habitable){{Cite web|url=http://www.skyscrapercenter.com/building/central-park-tower/14269|title=Central Park Tower - The Skyscraper Center|website=www.skyscrapercenter.com|access-date=2018-10-10}} | elevator_count = | cost = | floor_area = | architect = [[Adrian Smith + Gordon Gill Architecture]] | structural_engineer = | main_contractor = | developer = [[Extell Development Company]] | owner = | management = }} '''Central Park Tower''' (also known as the '''Nordstrom Tower''' and '''225 West 57th Street''') is a [[supertall]] mixed-use commercial/residential project being developed by the [[Extell Development Company]] and [[Shanghai Municipal Investment Group]]{{cite news|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2016-08-14/extell-s-nyc-luxury-condo-project-gets-needed-cash-at-a-price|title=Chinese Fund NYC's Tallest Residential Skyscraper—at a Price|date=15 August 2016|access-date=30 August 2017|work=Bloomberg}} in [[Midtown Manhattan|Midtown]] [[Manhattan]], [[New York City]], in the [[U.S. state]] of [[New York (state)|New York]]. The building will rise {{convert|1550|ft|0}} to the roof.{{cite web|url=http://a810-bisweb.nyc.gov/bisweb/JobsQueryByNumberServlet?requestid=3&passjobnumber=121328205&passdocnumber=07|title=Premises: 217 WEST 57 STREET MANHATTAN|publisher=bisweb|accessdate=July 18, 2014}} Upon completion, Central Park Tower will become the [[List of tallest buildings in the United States|second-tallest skyscraper in the United States]] and the tallest by roof height in the United States, surpassing the [[Willis Tower]]. The building is also notable for its former proposed architectural height of {{convert|1775|ft|m}}, one foot shorter than the symbolic {{convert|1776|ft|m|adj=on}} height of [[One World Trade Center]]. ==Design== The building is designed by [[Adrian Smith + Gordon Gill Architecture]]. The first seven floors of the tower will be [[Anchor store|anchored]] by New York City's first [[Nordstrom]] department store.{{cite web|author=Izzy Grinspan|date=June 28, 2012|url=http://ny.racked.com/archives/2012/06/28/nordstrom_will_open_on_w57th_street_sometime_around_2018.php|title=Nordstrom Will Open on W.57th Street Sometime Around 2018|publisher=Racked|accessdate=July 18, 2014}} Floors eight to twelve will house amenity spaces for residents.{{cite web|url=http://sourceable.net/nordstrom-tower-worlds-tallest-residential-building/|title=Nordstrom Tower to be World’s Tallest Residential Building |publisher=Racked|accessdate=July 18, 2014}} Due to another residential project, [[220 Central Park South]], under construction directly across the street from 225 West 57th Street, Extell purchased [[air rights]] to build a cantilever over the [[Art Students League of New York]]'s building, to which the League's members voted in favor.{{cite web|url=http://www.newyorkyimby.com/2014/02/approved-217-west-57th-street.html|title=Approved: 217 West 57th Street|publisher=New York YIMBY|accessdate=July 18, 2014}} Official renderings were revealed on New York YIMBY on April 20, 2015.{{cite web | author=New York YIMBY | date=April 20, 2015 | url=http://www.newyorkyimby.com/2015/04/revealed-217-west-57th-street-official-renderings-for-worlds-future-tallest-residential-building.html|title=Revealed: 217 West 57th Street, Official Renderings For World’s Future Tallest Residential Building|publisher=New York YIMBY|accessdate=April 20, 2015}} According to an announcement on June 25, 2015, the ornamental spire was officially removed from the design. The building will have 95 habitable floors.{{Cite web|url=http://www.skyscrapercenter.com/building/central-park-tower/14269|title=Central Park Tower - The Skyscraper Center|website=www.skyscrapercenter.com|access-date=2018-10-10}} [[File:W58 pencil bldgs 2018 jeh.jpg|thumb|right|250px|Looking east along 58th Street, Sept 2018.]] ==Construction issues & incidents== A lawsuit was filed by the [[Art Students League]], against their board for selling the rights to build the tower. However, the State Supreme Court judge dismissed the case stating that there was not enough evidence to support the claims of the 200 league members.{{cite news|url=https://www.nydailynews.com/life-style/real-estate/art-students-league-loses-battle-skyscraper-article-1.1891321|title=Judge tosses lawsuit brought by Art Students League against giant 57th St. skyscraper |date=4 August 2014|access-date=16 November 2018|work=New York Daily News}} A 3,000 pound glass panel standing at the ground floor tipped over on top of a security guard at the building's construction site on May 26, 2018. The security guard was declared dead at the hospital. A construction worker at the scene had tried to rescue the security guard, and ended up fracturing his right foot.{{cite news|url=https://www.nydailynews.com/new-york/security-guard-struck-killed-skyscraper-falling-glass-article-1.4011406|title=Security guard dies after falling glass from Central Park Tower skyscraper strikes him |date=26 May 2018|access-date=16 November 2018|work=New York Daily News}} After the incident, the [[New York City Department of Buildings]] ordered a halt on all construction work at the site.{{cite news|url=https://www.nydailynews.com/new-york/guard-died-nyc-tower-construction-accident-history-article-1.4012961|title=City suspends construction on Midtown skyscraper after falling glass killed security guard |date=27 May 2018|access-date=16 November 2018|work=New York Daily News}} ==See also== *[[List of tallest buildings in New York City]] *[[List of tallest buildings in the United States]] *[[List of tallest residential buildings]] *[[List of tallest buildings in the world]] ==Tenants== *Ground: Lobby, Retail *Floors 1-7: [[Nordstrom]] *Floors 8-12: Hotel *Floors 13-35: Residences *Floor 36: Sky Garden *Floors 37-75: Residences *Floor 76: Resident Lounge *Floor 77-95: Residences *Floors 95-130: Mechanical ==References== {{reflist|30em}} ==External links== *[https://extell.com/portfolio/central-park-tower Official website] *[http://www.skyscrapercenter.com/building/central-park-tower/14269 Central Park Tower] on [[CTBUH]] *[https://www.emporis.com/buildings/1215963/central-park-tower-new-york-city-ny-usa Central Park Tower] on [[Emporis]] *[http://skyscraperpage.com/cities/?buildingID=95079 Central Park Tower] on
