{{pp-blp|small=yes}} {{short description|American investor, real-estate developer, newspaper publisher, and senior advisor to President Donald Trump}} {{Use mdy dates|date=August 2018}} {{Infobox officeholder | name = Jared Kushner | image = Jared Kushner 2018.jpg | office1 = [[Senior Advisor to the President of the United States|Senior Advisor to the President]] | alongside1 = [[Stephen Miller (political advisor)|Stephen Miller]] | president1 = [[Donald Trump]] | term_start1 = January 20, 2017 | term_end1 = | successor1 = | office2 = Director of the [[Office of American Innovation]] | president2 = [[Donald Trump]] | term_start2 = March 27, 2017 | term_end2 = | predecessor2 = ''Position established'' | successor2 = | birth_name = Jared Corey Kushner | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1981|1|10}} | birth_place = [[Livingston, New Jersey]], U.S. | death_date = | death_place = | spouse = {{marriage|[[Ivanka Trump]]|October 25, 2009}} | children = 3 | father = [[Charles Kushner]] | relatives = [[Joseph Kushner]] (grandfather)
[[Joshua Kushner]] (brother)
[[Murray Kushner]] (uncle)
[[Marc Kushner]] (cousin) | education = [[Harvard University]] ([[Bachelor of Arts|AB]])
[[New York University]] ([[Juris Doctor|JD]], [[Master of Business Administration|MBA]]) |awards= [[Order of the Aztec Eagle]] (2018){{cite web |title= Jared Kushner receives "Aztec Eagle" award from Mexican government |url=https://www.cbsnews.com/news/jared-kushner-receives-aztec-eagle-award-from-mexican-government/|website=CBS |accessdate=November 30, 2018 |language=en |date=November 30, 2018}} }} '''Jared Corey Kushner''' (born January 10, 1981) is an American investor, real-estate developer, and newspaper publisher who is currently [[Senior Advisor to the President of the United States|senior advisor]] to his [[father-in-law]], [[Donald Trump]], the [[President of the United States]]. Kushner is the elder son of real-estate developer [[Charles Kushner]] and is married to [[Ivanka Trump]], President Trump's daughter and advisor. He was chief executive officer of the real-estate holding and development company [[Kushner Companies]], and of [[Observer Media]], publisher of the ''[[New York Observer]]''. He is the co-founder and part owner of [[Cadre (company)|Cadre]], an online real-estate investment platform. During the [[Donald Trump presidential campaign, 2016|2016 Trump presidential campaign]], Kushner helped develop and run Trump's digital media strategy. On January 9, 2017, he was named as a senior White House advisor. == Early life (1981–2007) == Kushner was born in [[Livingston, New Jersey]], to Seryl Kushner (née Stadtmauer) and Charles Kushner, a real-estate developer.{{cite web |url=http://nymag.com/news/features/57891/ |title=The Legacy |publisher=New York |date=July 12, 2009 |first=Gabriel |last=Sherman |accessdate=January 3, 2015 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150103120035/http://nymag.com/news/features/57891/ |archivedate=January 3, 2015 }} His paternal grandparents, Reichel and [[Joseph Kushner]], were Holocaust survivors who came to the U.S. in 1949 from [[Navahrudak|Navahrudak, Belarus]].{{Cite web |url=https://belarusdigest.com/story/what-does-trumps-presidency-mean-for-belarus/ |title=What Does Trump's Presidency Mean for Belarus? |last=Rudnik |first=Alesia |last2=Smok |first2=Vadzim |date=November 18, 2016 |website=[[Belarus Digest]] |archive-url=https://archive.today/20180709183434/https://belarusdigest.com/story/what-does-trumps-presidency-mean-for-belarus/ |archive-date=July 9, 2018 |dead-url=no |access-date=July 9, 2018 }}{{cite web |url=http://nymag.com/daily/intelligencer/2017/01/jared-kushner-trump-administration-power.html |title=The Young Trump: Jared Kushner's Rise to Unimaginable Power |first=Andrew |last=Rice |magazine=New York |date=January 8, 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170115000329/http://nymag.com/daily/intelligencer/2017/01/jared-kushner-trump-administration-power.html |archivedate=January 15, 2017 }} Morris Stadtmauer was the maternal grandfather of Jared Kusnher.{{cite web |title=Kushner Insider January 30, 2015 |url=https://www.jkha.org/pages/weekly-updates/digest/kushner-insider-1-30-15 |website=[[Joseph Kushner Hebrew Academy]]/[[Rae Kushner Yeshiva High School]] |accessdate=July 7, 2018 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160422084708/https://www.jkha.org/pages/weekly-updates/digest/kushner-insider-1-30-15 |archivedate=April 22, 2016 |date=January 30, 2015}} Kushner was raised in a [[Modern Orthodox Judaism|Modern Orthodox Jewish]] family.{{cite web |url=http://www.jpost.com/Diaspora/Jared-Kushner-once-broke-up-with-Ivanka-Trump-over-religion-issue-464353 |title=Jared Kushner once broke up with Ivanka Trump over 'religion issue' |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170224132903/http://www.jpost.com/Diaspora/Jared-Kushner-once-broke-up-with-Ivanka-Trump-over-religion-issue-464353 |archivedate=February 24, 2017 }} He graduated from the [[Frisch School]], a Modern Orthodox [[Jewish day school|yeshiva high school]], in 1999. He was an [[honors student]] and a member of the debate, hockey, and basketball teams.{{cite web |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/in-fathers-scandal-the-genesis-of-jared-kushners-unflinching-loyalty/2016/11/27/1e9497ba-b378-11e6-840f-e3ebab6bcdd3_story.html |title=For Trump son-in-law and confidant Jared Kushner, a long history of fierce loyalty |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161128075620/https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/in-fathers-scandal-the-genesis-of-jared-kushners-unflinching-loyalty/2016/11/27/1e9497ba-b378-11e6-840f-e3ebab6bcdd3_story.html |archivedate=November 28, 2016 }} Kushner enrolled at [[Harvard University]] in 1999. Journalist [[Daniel Golden]] has alleged that Kushner was accepted due to his father's donations and history with the school.{{cite web |last1=Prokop |first1=Andrew |title=As Trump takes aim at affirmative action, let's remember how Jared Kushner got into Harvard |url=https://www.vox.com/policy-and-politics/2017/8/2/16084226/jared-kushner-harvard-affirmative-action |website=[[Vox.com]] |publisher=[[Vox Media, Inc.]] |date=August 2, 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180124135619/https://www.vox.com/policy-and-politics/2017/8/2/16084226/jared-kushner-harvard-affirmative-action |archivedate=January 24, 2018 }}{{cite web |last1=Golden |first1=Daniel |title=The Story Behind Jared Kushner's Curious Acceptance into Harvard |url=https://www.propublica.org/article/the-story-behind-jared-kushners-curious-acceptance-into-harvard |website=[[Propublica.org]] |publisher=Pro Publica Inc. |accessdate=January 24, 2018 |date=November 18, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180124042137/https://www.propublica.org/article/the-story-behind-jared-kushners-curious-acceptance-into-harvard |archivedate=January 24, 2018 }} He was elected into the [[Fly Club]], supported the campus [[Chabad]] house,{{cite web |last=Sales |first=Ben |title=Jared Kushner's College Rabbi Recalls a Snow-Shoveling Student Mega-Donor |publisher=[[Jewish Telegraphic Agency]] |date=January 27, 2017 |url=http://www.jta.org/2017/01/27/news-opinion/politics/jared-kushners-college-rabbi-recalls-a-snow-shoveling-student-mega-donor |quote=Beyond the surprise [$18,000] donation, Kushner ... recruited students to Chabad's programs, performed workaday tasks for the house and served as the emcee when Chabad dedicated a new building in 2003. |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170129051923/http://www.jta.org/2017/01/27/news-opinion/politics/jared-kushners-college-rabbi-recalls-a-snow-shoveling-student-mega-donor |archivedate=January 29, 2017 }}{{cite web |last=Nielsen |first=Jason |date=April 24, 2003 |title=Chabad House a Home to Many; Orthodox Jewish Organization Is Thriving at Liberal Harvard Campus |url=http://www.hcs.harvard.edu/chabad/news%20articles/news_advocate.html |deadurl=no |newspaper=[[The Jewish Advocate]] |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100705135212/http://www.hcs.harvard.edu/chabad/news%20articles/news_advocate.html |archivedate=July 5, 2010 }} and bought and sold real estate in [[Somerville, Massachusetts]], as a vice president of Somerville Building Associates (a division of Kushner Companies). Its other vice president was his maternal uncle, Richard Stadtmauer, then vice chairman of Kushner Companies.{{cite web |last=Whitehouse |first=Kaja |date=September 12, 2016 |title=Family of Trump's Son-in-Law Linked to Hedge Fund Probe |url=https://nypost.com/2016/09/12/family-of-trumps-son-in-law-linked-to-hedge-fund-probe/ |newspaper=[[New York Post]] |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170418041556/http://nypost.com/2016/09/12/family-of-trumps-son-in-law-linked-to-hedge-fund-probe/ |archivedate=April 18, 2017 }} The venture was dissolved in 2005 after returning a profit of $20 million.{{cite web |last=Pendergrass |first=Drew |title=Becoming Jared Kushner |magazine=[[The Harvard Crimson|Harvard Crimson]] |date=March 9, 2017 |url=http://www.thecrimson.com/article/2017/3/9/jared-kushner-undergrad/ |quote=Kushner was vice president of 10 corporations as an undergrad, each of which operated as a part of Kushner Companies... Richard Stadtmauer, Jared Kushner's uncle and the only other vice president ... listed in publicly available documents, was convicted of felony tax fraud in 2009 and sentenced to 38 months... |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170320145401/http://www.thecrimson.com/article/2017/3/9/jared-kushner-undergrad/ |archivedate=March 20, 2017 }}{{cite web |last=Birkner |first=Gabrielle |title=Kushner Quietly Raising His Stake in Manhattan |newspaper=[[The New York Sun|New York Sun]] |date=August 4, 2006 |url=http://www.nysun.com/new-york/kushner-quietly-raising-his-stake-in-manhattan/37370/ |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170121043403/http://www.nysun.com/new-york/kushner-quietly-raising-his-stake-in-manhattan/37370 |archivedate=January 21, 2017 }} Kushner graduated from Harvard in 2003 with a Bachelor of Arts degree in government.{{cite web |url=http://www.businessinsider.com/most-powerful-harvard-graduates-2017-4 |title=18 of the most powerful Harvard graduates alive |work=Business Insider |date=April 28, 2017 |first=Peter |last=Jacobs |first2=Abby |last2=Jackson |accessdate=March 22, 2018 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171222051112/http://www.businessinsider.com/most-powerful-harvard-graduates-2017-4 |archivedate=December 22, 2017 }}{{cite web |last1=Golden |first1=Daniel |title=How Did 'Less Than Stellar' High School Student Jared Kushner Get into Harvard? |url=https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2016/nov/18/jared-kushner-harvard-donald-trump-son-in-law |website=''[[The Guardian]]'' |date=November 18, 2016 |authorlink=Daniel Golden |quote=Charles and Seryl Kushner were both on [Harvard's Committee on University Resources]... His sons Jared and Joshua had both enrolled there... In 1998 ... [Charles] had pledged $2.5m to Harvard ... [and] also visited Neil Rudenstine, then Harvard president, and discussed funding a scholarship program for low- and middle-income students. |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170408051526/https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2016/nov/18/jared-kushner-harvard-donald-trump-son-in-law |archivedate=April 8, 2017 }} Kushner graduated from [[New York University]] in 2007 with dual [[Juris Doctor|JD]]/[[Masters in Business Administration|MBA]] degrees. He interned at Manhattan District Attorney [[Robert Morgenthau]]'s office, and at [[Paul, Weiss, Rifkind, Wharton & Garrison LLP]].Pillets, Jeff; Riley, Clint (June 16, 2002). "Paying for Power: The Kushner Network", ''[[Bergen Record]]'', p. 1. == Business career (2006–2017) == === Real estate === Kushner was a real-estate investor, and increased Kushner Companies' presence in the New York City real-estate market.{{cite web |title=Kushner Quietly Raising His Stake in Manhattan |url=http://www.nysun.com/new-york/kushner-quietly-raising-his-stake-in-manhattan/37370 |accessdate=August 4, 2006 |newspaper=[[The New York Sun]] |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100402215749/http://www.nysun.com/new-york/kushner-quietly-raising-his-stake-in-manhattan/37370 |archivedate=April 2, 2010 }} [[File:666fifth-front.jpg|thumb|left|upright|Kushner Companies purchased [[666 Fifth Avenue]] in 2007 for $1.8 billion, the most expensive single property purchase in US history at the time.{{cite web |url=http://therealdeal.com/issues_articles/behind-the-record-deal-for-666-fifth-avenue |title=Behind the record deal for 666 Fifth Avenue |date=October 22, 2007 |first=Adam |last=Piore |work=The Real Deal |publisher=Korangy Publishing Inc. |accessdate=September 30, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161001053022/http://therealdeal.com/issues_articles/behind-the-record-deal-for-666-fifth-avenue/ |archivedate=October 1, 2016 }}]] Kushner Companies purchased the office building at [[666 Fifth Avenue]] in 2007, for a then-record price of $1.8 billion, most of it borrowed. He assumed the role of CEO in 2008.{{cite web |url=http://therealdeal.com/issues_articles/jared-kushner-the-accidental-ceo |title=Jared Kushner, the accidental CEO |last=Clarke |first=Katherine |date=February 1, 2014 |work=[[The Real Deal (magazine)|The Real Deal]] |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140610113516/http://therealdeal.com/issues_articles/jared-kushner-the-accidental-ceo/ |archivedate=June 10, 2014 |deadurl=no |accessdate=June 8, 2014 }} Following the property crash that year, the cash flow generated by the property was insufficient to cover its debt service, and the Kushners were forced to sell the retail footage to [[Stanley Chera]][http://therealdeal.com/blog/2013/06/03/crown-highgate-to-pay-1-3b-for-650-madison/ The Real Deal: "$1.3B sale of 650 Madison hinges on dramatic increase in retail value, sources say" by Adam Pincus] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140203083805/http://therealdeal.com/blog/2013/06/03/crown-highgate-to-pay-1-3b-for-650-madison/ |date=February 3, 2014 }} June 3, 2013 and bring in [[Vornado Realty Trust]] as a 50% [[equity partner]] in the ownership of the building.{{cite web |url=http://www.crainsnewyork.com/dcce/20110913/12/real_estate/122/deals_active/2639480 |title=Private equity outfit signs on at 666 Fifth |first=Theresa |last=Agovino |work=[[Crain's New York Business]] |date=September 13, 2011 |accessdate=October 21, 2011 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111017021305/http://www.crainsnewyork.com/dcce/20110913/12/real_estate/122/deals_active/2639480 |archivedate=October 17, 2011 }} By that time, Kushner Companies had lost more than $90 million on its investment.{{cite web |last=Pincus |first=Adam |title=Tallying Who Won at 666 Fifth Avenue |magazine=[[The Real Deal (magazine)|The Real Deal]] |date=August 2012 |url=https://therealdeal.com/issues_articles/a-666-fifth-scorecard/ |quote=''The Real Deal'' created a scorecard estimating how much in profits (or losses) all of the parties involved in 666 Fifth Avenue have walked away with. • ''Kushner Companies''. ''Retail'': Estimated profits of about $100 to $120 million. ''Office'': Estimated current loss ... of more than $200 million. |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170201030409/https://therealdeal.com/issues_articles/a-666-fifth-scorecard/ |archivedate=February 1, 2017 }} He was the face of the deal but his father Charles Kushner pushed him to do the deal.{{cite web |last=Alesci |first=Cristina |authorlink1=Cristina Alesci |title=Charles Kushner: 'I pushed Jared to do the deal' for 666 Fifth Ave. |url=https://edition.cnn.com/2018/04/23/politics/charles-jared-kushner-666-fifth-avenue/index.html |publisher=CNN |accessdate=July 7, 2018 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180707175642/https://edition.cnn.com/2018/04/23/politics/charles-jared-kushner-666-fifth-avenue/index.html |archivedate=July 7, 2018 }} On August 18, 2014, Kushner acquired a three-building apartment portfolio in [[Middle River, Maryland]], for $38 million with Aion Partners. In 2013–2014, he and his company acquired more than 11,000 units throughout New York, New Jersey, and the [[Baltimore, Maryland|Baltimore]] area.{{cite web |url=http://www.bizjournals.com/baltimore/blog/real-estate/2014/08/donald-trumps-son-in-law-buys-3-middle-river.html |title=Donald Trump's son-in-law buys 3 Middle River apartment complexes |publisher=Bizjournal |date=August 18, 2014 |accessdate=August 20, 2014 |author=Kevin Litten |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140822013210/http://www.bizjournals.com/baltimore/blog/real-estate/2014/08/donald-trumps-son-in-law-buys-3-middle-river.html |archivedate=August 22, 2014 }} In May 2015, he purchased 50.1% of the [[The Times Square Building|Times Square Building]] from [[Africa Israel Investments]] Ltd. for $295 million. [[File:One Times Square May 2014.jpg|thumb|upright|In May 2015, Kushner purchased a majority stake of [[One Times Square]] for $295 million.{{cite web |last=Ben-Israel |first=Adi |date=May 14, 2015 |url=http://www.globes.co.il/en/article-africa-israel-sells-times-square-building-for-295m-1001036416 |title=Africa Israel sells Times Square building for $295m |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150516204206/http://www.globes.co.il/en/article-africa-israel-sells-times-square-building-for-295m-1001036416 |archivedate=May 16, 2015 |work=[[Globes]] English}}]] In 2014, Kushner, with his brother [[Joshua Kushner|Joshua]] and [[Ryan Williams (entrepreneur)|Ryan Williams]], co-founded [[Cadre (company)|Cadre]] (now RealCadre LLC), an online real-estate investment platform. His business partners included [[Goldman Sachs]] and billionaire [[George Soros]], a top Democratic Party donor.{{cite web |last=Kirby |first=Jen |title=Jared Kushner Reportedly Failed to Disclose Stake in Real-Estate Tech Start-Up |magazine=[[New York (magazine)|New York]] |date=May 2, 2017 |url=http://nymag.com/daily/intelligencer/2017/05/report-jared-kushner-failed-to-disclose-stake-in-startup.html |quote=Kushner did not list his part-ownership in a real-estate start-up called Cadre, whose investors include a Goldman Sachs fund ... and George Soros, the Democratic megadonor and favorite target of the Trumpian base. |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170505032452/http://nymag.com/daily/intelligencer/2017/05/report-jared-kushner-failed-to-disclose-stake-in-startup.html |archivedate=May 5, 2017 }}{{cite web |last=Sorvino |first=Chloe |title=Here's How Much Jared Kushner and His Family Are Really Worth |magazine=Forbes |date=December 18, 2016 |url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/chloesorvino/2016/12/18/jared-josh-kushner-fortune-donald-trump-real-estate/ |quote=Josh ... and Jared also cofounded Cadre, an online platform for investing in real estate, in 2014. Two years later, it raised $50 million from a group of big-name investors including Goldman Sachs ... billionaire George Soros's private equity firm and Russian billionaire tech investor Yuri Milner. |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170511044352/https://www.forbes.com/sites/chloesorvino/2016/12/18/jared-josh-kushner-fortune-donald-trump-real-estate/ |archivedate=May 11, 2017 }} In early 2015, [[Soros Fund Management]] financed the startup with a $250 million credit line.{{cite web |last=Chung |first=Juliet |title=A Tech Startup's Major Investors |newspaper=The Wall Street Journal |page=A2 |date=May 3, 2017 |quote=Kushner co-founded Cadre in 2014... To get off the ground, Cadre turned to a Goldman Sachs fund and a number of high-profile investors... Cadre also secured a $250 million line of credit from the family office of George Soros... Soros' family office is also an investor in Cadre.}}{{cite web |last=Putzier |first=Konrad |title=George Soros is the secret financier behind Kushner-backed startup Cadre |magazine=[[The Real Deal (magazine)|The Real Deal]] |date=January 27, 2017 |url=https://therealdeal.com/2017/01/27/george-soros-is-the-secret-financier-behind-kushner-backed-startup-cadre/ |quote=George Soros' Soros Fund Management has quietly been financing the Kushner-backed real estate finance startup Cadre with a substantial credit line, according to sources familiar with the matter. |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170515104641/https://therealdeal.com/2017/01/27/george-soros-is-the-secret-financier-behind-kushner-backed-startup-cadre/ |archivedate=May 15, 2017 }} Kushner did not identify these business relationships in his January 2017 government financial-disclosure form.{{cite web |last1=Eaglesham |first1=Jean |last2=Chung |first2=Juliet |last3=Schwartz |first3=Lisa |date=May 3, 2017 |title=Trump Adviser Kushner's Undisclosed Partners Include Goldman and Soros |url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/trump-adviser-jared-kushner-didnt-disclose-startup-stake-1493717405 |newspaper=The Wall Street Journal |page=1 |quote=Kushner ... is currently in business with Goldman Sachs Group Inc. and billionaires George Soros and Peter Thiel, according to people familiar with the matter and securities filings. |url-access=subscription |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170504052135/https://www.wsj.com/articles/trump-adviser-jared-kushner-didnt-disclose-startup-stake-1493717405 |archivedate=May 4, 2017 }} === Newspaper publishing === [[File:Jared Kushner and Peter Kaplan (cropped).jpg|thumb|[[Peter W. Kaplan]] and Kushner, September 2008]] In 2006, Kushner purchased ''[[The New York Observer]]'', a weekly New York City newspaper, for $10 million,Seelye, Katharine Q. (July 31, 2006). [https://www.nytimes.com/2006/07/31/business/media/31observer.html "Developer's Son Acquires The New York Observer"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170704224359/http://www.nytimes.com/2006/07/31/business/media/31observer.html |date=July 4, 2017 }}. ''[[The New York Times]]''. Retrieved January 8, 2008. using money he says he earned during his college years by closing deals on residential buildings in Somerville, Massachusetts, with family members providing the backing for his investments.{{Cite web |title=Kushner Buys NY Observer |work=The Harvard Crimson |url=http://www.thecrimson.com/article/2006/8/4/kushner-buys-ny-observer-jared-c/ |date=August 4, 2006 |accessdate=January 2, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160303173900/http://www.thecrimson.com/article/2006/8/4/kushner-buys-ny-observer-jared-c/ |archivedate=March 3, 2016 }} After purchasing the ''Observer'', Kushner published it in [[Tabloid (newspaper format)|tabloid]] format.Teodorczuk, Tom (November 9, 2008). [https://www.theguardian.com/media/2008/nov/10/interview-jared-kushner "An accidental proprietor"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170111001510/https://www.theguardian.com/media/2008/nov/10/interview-jared-kushner |date=January 11, 2017 }}. ''The Guardian'' (London). Retrieved October 21, 2011. Since then, he has been credited with increasing the ''Observer''{{'}}s online presence and expanding the Observer Media Group.{{cite web |title=We've Got the BetaBeat |url=http://www.observer.com/2011/we-got-betabeat-observers-tech-site-launches-tomorrow |date=March 15, 2011 |work=[[The New York Observer]] |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110427212734/http://www.observer.com/2011/we-got-betabeat-observers-tech-site-launches-tomorrow |archivedate=April 27, 2011 }}{{cite web |title=Kushner and Observer Media Group Acquire 80 Percent Stake in Barry Diller's Vary Short List |url=http://www.nypost.com/p/news/business/item_i6IUlVRWFNy5ntZsYjlCaP |date=June 15, 2009 |work=[[New York Post]] |first=Peter |last=Lauria |accessdate=December 26, 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130310044447/http://www.nypost.com/p/news/business/item_i6IUlVRWFNy5ntZsYjlCaP |archivedate=March 10, 2013 }} With no substantial experience in journalism, Kushner could not establish a good relationship with the newspaper's veteran editor-in-chief, [[Peter W. Kaplan]].{{cite web |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2016/11/20/us/politics/jared-kushner-donald-trump.html |title=The In-Law in the Trump Inner Circle: Jared Kushner's Steadying Hand |newspaper=The New York Times|access-date=November 20, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161121081715/http://www.nytimes.com/2016/11/20/us/politics/jared-kushner-donald-trump.html |archivedate=November 21, 2016 }} "This guy doesn't know what he doesn't know", Kaplan remarked about Kushner, to colleagues, at the time. As a result of his differences with Kushner, Kaplan quit his position. Kaplan was followed by a series of short-lived successors until Kushner hired Elizabeth Spiers in 2011.{{cite web |url=https://www.bloomberg.com/features/2016-jared-kushner-trump-card |title=Jared Kushner's Trump Card |publisher=Bloomberg L.P.|access-date=November 16, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161116104142/http://www.bloomberg.com/features/2016-jared-kushner-trump-card/ |archivedate=November 16, 2016 }} It has been alleged that Kushner used Observer as propaganda against rivals in real estate.{{cite web |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/new-york-observer-alum-how-jared-kushner-targeted-a-real-estate-rival-993099 |title=New York Observer Alum on How Jared Kushner Targeted a Real Estate Rival |newspaper=The Hollywood Reporter|access-date=April 12, 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170412205159/http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/new-york-observer-alum-how-jared-kushner-targeted-a-real-estate-rival-993099 |archivedate=April 12, 2017 }} Spiers left the newspaper in 2012. In January 2013, Kushner hired a new editor-in-chief, [[Ken Kurson]]. Kurson had been a consultant to Republican political candidates in New Jersey. According to ''[[Vanity Fair (magazine)|Vanity Fair]]'', under Kushner, the "''Observer'' has lost virtually all of its cultural currency among New York's elite, but the paper is now profitable and reporting traffic growth ... [it] boasts 6 million unique visitors per month, up from 1.3 million in January 2013".Ellison, Sarah (July 7, 2016). [http://www.vanityfair.com/news/2016/07/jared-kushner-donald-trump-mini-me "Exclusive: How Jared Kushner became Donald Trump's Mini-Me"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160708122557/http://www.vanityfair.com/news/2016/07/jared-kushner-donald-trump-mini-me |date=July 8, 2016 }}, ''Vanity Fair''. In April 2016, the ''New York Observer'' became one of only a [[List of Donald Trump presidential campaign endorsements, 2016#Newspapers, magazines, and other media|handful of newspapers]] to officially endorse United States presidential candidate Donald Trump in the Republican primary, but the paper ended the campaign period by choosing not to back any presidential candidate at all.{{cite web |url=http://observer.com/2016/04/in-the-republican-primary-donald-trump-for-president/ |title=In the Republican Primary: Donald Trump for President |date=April 12, 2016 |work=The New York Observer |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161001035111/http://observer.com/2016/04/in-the-republican-primary-donald-trump-for-president/ |archivedate=October 1, 2016 }}{{cite web |url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/entry/donald-trump-new-york-observer_us_5819f55ae4b092edafb57456 |title=Donald Trump Will Not Get His Son-In-Law's Paper's Endorsement |first=Michael |last=Calderone |work=HuffPost |date=November 2, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161107221440/http://www.huffingtonpost.com/entry/donald-trump-new-york-observer_us_5819f55ae4b092edafb57456 |archivedate=November 7, 2016 }} Kushner stepped down from his newspaper role in January 2017 to pursue a role in President Donald Trump's administration. He was replaced by his brother-in-law.{{cite web |last=McAlone |first=Nathan |title=Trump son-in-law Jared Kushner will step down as publisher of the Observer, and have no 'ownership stake' |url=http://www.businessinsider.com/jared-kushner-steps-down-as-publisher-of-the-observer-2017-1 |accessdate=February 27, 2017 |work=Business Insider |date=January 9, 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20170512112415/http://www.businessinsider.com/jared-kushner-steps-down-as-publisher-of-the-observer-2017-1 |archivedate=May 12, 2017 }} == Politics (2016–2018) == === Political background === Jared Kushner had been a lifelong Democrat prior to Donald Trump entering politics.{{cite web |last=Schallhorn |first=Kaitlyn |title=Jared Kushner's ties to the White House, link to the Russia investigation |url=http://www.foxnews.com/politics/2018/02/27/jared-kushners-ties-to-white-house-link-to-russia-investigation.html |publisher=Fox News Channel |accessdate=June 27, 2018 |date=February 27, 2018 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180618160542/http://www.foxnews.com/politics/2018/02/27/jared-kushners-ties-to-white-house-link-to-russia-investigation.html |archivedate=June 18, 2018 }} He had donated over $10,000 to Democratic campaigns{{cite web |last=Milord |first=Joseph |title=Jared Kushner's Brother Reportedly Donated A Lot Of Money To March For Our Lives |url=https://www.elitedaily.com/p/jared-kushners-brother-reportedly-donated-money-to-march-for-our-lives-its-a-lot-8487782 |website=Elite Daily |accessdate=June 27, 2018 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180628015501/https://www.elitedaily.com/p/jared-kushners-brother-reportedly-donated-money-to-march-for-our-lives-its-a-lot-8487782 |archivedate=June 28, 2018 }} starting at young age of 11. In 2008 he donated to the campaign for [[Hillary Clinton]] and his newspaper the ''[[New York Observer]]'' endorsed Barack Obama over [[John McCain]] in the [[United States presidential election, 2008|US presidential election]].{{cite web |last=Mathis-Lilley |first=Ben |title=Trump's Family Really Has a Long History of Giving Money to, Praising, and Endorsing Democrats |url=http://www.slate.com/blogs/the_slatest/2016/07/21/trumps_kushner_have_history_of_supporting_clinton_obama_other_democrats.html |website=Slate |accessdate=June 27, 2018 |date=July 21, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180709184250/http://www.slate.com/blogs/the_slatest/2016/07/21/trumps_kushner_have_history_of_supporting_clinton_obama_other_democrats.html |archivedate=July 9, 2018 }} but after disappointment with [[Barack Obama]] he endorsed Republican US presidential race nominee [[Mitt Romney]] in 2012 via the ''[[New York Observer]]''.{{cite web |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2017/02/11/us/politics/jared-kushner-israel.html |title=For Kushner, Israel Policy May Be Shaped by the Personal |first=Jodi |last=Kantor |date=February 11, 2017 |work=The New York Times |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170710180142/https://www.nytimes.com/2017/02/11/us/politics/jared-kushner-israel.html |archivedate=July 10, 2017 }} In 2014 he continued to donate to Democratic groups,{{r|SupportHistoryDemocrats}} but he then continued his "ideological conversion" by joining his father-in-law Donald Trump's nascent US presidential campaign in 2015.{{refn|{{cite web |work=The New York Times |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2016/11/20/us/politics/jared-kushner-donald-trump.html|title=The In-Law in the Trump Inner Circle: Jared Kushner's Steadying Hand |author=Jonathan Mahler & [[Maggie Haberman]] |date=November 19, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170307112355/https://www.nytimes.com/2016/11/20/us/politics/jared-kushner-donald-trump.html |archivedate=March 7, 2017 }}{{cite magazine |title=Jared Kushner, Trump's Unlikely Wing Man |author=Berg, Rebecca |date=May 31, 2016 |work=[[RealClearPolitics]] |url=http://www.realclearpolitics.com/articles/2016/05/31/jared_kushner_trumps_unlikely_wing_man.html |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170202062957/http://www.realclearpolitics.com/articles/2016/05/31/jared_kushner_trumps_unlikely_wing_man.html |archivedate=February 2, 2017 }}{{cite magazine |title=Trump's Family Really Has a Long History of Giving Money to, Praising, and Endorsing Democrats |author=Mathis-Lilley, Ben |date=July 21, 2016 |publisher=The Slate |url=http://www.slate.com/blogs/the_slatest/2016/07/21/trumps_kushner_have_history_of_supporting_clinton_obama_other_democrats.html |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170315091557/http://www.slate.com/blogs/the_slatest/2016/07/21/trumps_kushner_have_history_of_supporting_clinton_obama_other_democrats.html |archivedate=March 15, 2017 }}{{cite magazine |title=Observer Owner Jared Kushner: $100,000 in Political Contributions Since 1992 |author=Dylan |date=July 31, 2006 |work=Adweek |url=http://www.adweek.com/digital/observer-owner-jared-kushner-100000-in-political-contributions-since-1992/ |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170315093717/http://www.adweek.com/digital/observer-owner-jared-kushner-100000-in-political-contributions-since-1992/ |archivedate=March 15, 2017 }}}} Kushner had no prior involvement in campaign politics or in government before Trump's campaign.{{cite magazine |title=Jared Kushner's Second Act |author=Ward, Vicky |date=August 18, 2016 |publisher=Esquire |url=http://www.esquire.com/news-politics/a47697/jared-kushner-trump-campaign/ |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170314225911/http://www.esquire.com/news-politics/a47697/jared-kushner-trump-campaign/ |archivedate=March 14, 2017 }} === Presidential campaign === [[File:Trump CAUCUS (24471440220).jpg|thumb|right|Kushner and the [[Family of Donald Trump|Trump family]], pictured at a campaign victory party in [[Des Moines]], [[Iowa]], on February 1, 2016]] From the outset of the [[Donald Trump presidential campaign, 2016|presidential campaign]] of his father-in-law Donald Trump, Kushner was the architect of Trump's digital, online, and social media campaigns, enlisting talent from Silicon Valley to run a 100-person social-media team dubbed "Project Alamo".Fox, Emily Jane (October 27, 2016). [http://www.vanityfair.com/news/2016/10/jared-trump-trump-campaign "Was Donald Trump's son-in-law the evil genius all along?"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161030050251/http://www.vanityfair.com/news/2016/10/jared-trump-trump-campaign |date=October 30, 2016 }}, ''Vanity Fair''. Kushner has also helped as a speechwriter, and was tasked with working to establish a plan for Trump's White House transition team.Parker, Ashley (May 6, 2016). [https://www.nytimes.com/politics/first-draft/2016/05/06/trump-asks-his-son-in-law-jared-kushner-to-plan-for-a-transition-team "Trump Asks Son-in-Law, Jared Kushner, to Plan for Transition Team"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170224205352/https://www.nytimes.com/politics/first-draft/2016/05/06/trump-asks-his-son-in-law-jared-kushner-to-plan-for-a-transition-team/ |date=February 24, 2017 }}, ''The New York Times''. He was for a time seen as Trump's ''de facto'' [[campaign manager]], succeeding [[Corey Lewandowski]], who was fired in part on Kushner's recommendation in June 2016.{{cite web |last1=Barbaro |first1=Michael |last2=Mahler |first2=Jonathan |title=Quiet Fixer in Donald Trump's Campaign: His Son-in-Law, Jared Kushner |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2016/07/05/us/politics/jared-kushner-donald-trump.html |accessdate=July 5, 2016 |work=The New York Times |date=July 4, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160705001545/http://www.nytimes.com/2016/07/05/us/politics/jared-kushner-donald-trump.html |archivedate=July 5, 2016 }} He had been intimately involved with campaign strategy, coordinating Trump's visit in late August to Mexico, and he is believed to be responsible for the choice of [[Mike Pence]] as Trump's running mate.{{cite web |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2016/09/01/us/politics/trump-campaign.html |title=Trailing Hillary Clinton, Donald Trump Turns to Political Gymnastics |date=September 1, 2016 |work=The New York Times |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170226095255/https://www.nytimes.com/2016/09/01/us/politics/trump-campaign.html |archivedate=February 26, 2017 }} Kushner's "sprawling digital fundraising database and social media campaign" has been described as "the locus of his father-in-law's presidential bid".Green, Joshua (October 27, 2016). [https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2016-10-27/inside-the-trump-bunker-with-12-days-to-go "Inside the Trump Bunker, With Days to Go"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170226024744/https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2016-10-27/inside-the-trump-bunker-with-12-days-to-go |date=February 26, 2017 }}, ''Bloomberg Business''. According to former [[Google]] CEO [[Eric Schmidt]] (who worked on technology for [[2016 Presidential campaign of Hillary Clinton|Hillary Clinton's campaign]]), Kushner's role in the 2016 election was its biggest surprise. Schmidt told ''[[Forbes]]'', "Best I can tell, he actually ran the campaign and did it with essentially no resources."{{cite web |url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/stevenbertoni/2016/11/22/exclusive-interview-how-jared-kushner-won-trump-the-white-house/ |title=Exclusive Interview: How Jared Kushner Won Trump the White House |last=Bertoni |first=Steven |date=November 22, 2016 |website=Forbes |quote=Kushner went to a private Jewish high school and then to Harvard (a 2006 book about college admissions would later single out Kushner as a prime example of how children of wealthy donors get preferential treatment...). |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170504062939/https://www.forbes.com/sites/stevenbertoni/2016/11/22/exclusive-interview-how-jared-kushner-won-trump-the-white-house/ |archivedate=May 4, 2017 }} [[Federal Election Commission]] filings indicate the Trump campaign spent $343 million, about 59 percent as much as the Clinton campaign.{{cite report |title=Presidential Candidate 24-Month Data Summaries: Campaign Disbursements through December 31, 2016 |url=http://classic.fec.gov/press/summaries/2016/ElectionCycle/24m_PresCand.shtml |publisher=[[Federal Election Commission]] |year=2017 |quote=Total Disbursements}} On July 5, 2016, Kushner wrote an open letter in the ''[[New York Observer]]'' addressing the controversy around a [[Twitter|tweet]] from the Trump campaign containing allegedly [[Antisemitism|anti-Semitic]] imagery. He was responding to his own paper's editorial by Dana Schwartz criticizing Kushner's involvement with the Trump campaign.{{cite web |last1=Keneally |first1=Meghan |title=Kushner Defends Father-In-Law Donald Trump After Anti-Semitism Claims |url=http://abcnews.go.com/Politics/jared-kushner-defends-father-law-donald-trump-anti/story?id=40373483 |publisher=ABC News |accessdate=July 6, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160707153612/http://abcnews.go.com/Politics/jared-kushner-defends-father-law-donald-trump-anti/story?id=40373483 |archivedate=July 7, 2016 }} In the letter, Kushner wrote, "In my opinion, accusations like 'racist' and 'anti-Semite' are being thrown around with a carelessness that risks rendering these words meaningless."{{cite web |last1=Kushner |first1=Jared |title=Jared Kushner: The Donald Trump I Know |url=http://observer.com/2016/07/jared-kushner-the-donald-trump-i-know/ |work=[[The New York Observer]] |accessdate=July 6, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160706230652/http://observer.com/2016/07/jared-kushner-the-donald-trump-i-know/ |archivedate=July 6, 2016 }} === Presidential transition === [[File:Shinz%C5%8D Abe and Donald Trump (3).jpg|thumb|Japanese PM [[Shinzō Abe]] meets with Ivanka, president-elect Donald Trump, and Jared Kushner, November 2016]] During the [[United States presidential transition|presidential transition]], Kushner was said to be his father-in-law's "confidant",{{cite web |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/in-fathers-scandal-the-genesis-of-jared-kushners-unflinching-loyalty/2016/11/27/1e9497ba-b378-11e6-840f-e3ebab6bcdd3_story.html |title=For Trump son-in-law and confidant Jared Kushner, a long history of fierce loyalty |newspaper=The Washington Post|access-date=December 13, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161213034128/https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/in-fathers-scandal-the-genesis-of-jared-kushners-unflinching-loyalty/2016/11/27/1e9497ba-b378-11e6-840f-e3ebab6bcdd3_story.html |archivedate=December 13, 2016 }} and one of Donald Trump's closest advisors, even more so than Trump's four adult children.{{cite web |deadurl=no |url=https://www.politico.com/story/2016/11/donald-trump-team-rivals-231277 |title=Trump team rivalries spark infighting |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161118212223/http://www.politico.com/story/2016/11/donald-trump-team-rivals-231277 |archivedate=November 18, 2016 |author1=Kenneth P. Vogel |author2=Nancy Cook |author3=Alex Isenstadt |date=November 11, 2016 |work=[[Politico]]}} Trump was reported to have requested the top-secret security clearance for him to attend the [[President's Daily Brief|Presidential daily intelligence briefings]] as his staff-level companion, along with General [[Michael T. Flynn|Mike Flynn]], who already had the clearance prior to his resignation.[http://www.nbcnews.com/politics/politics-news/donald-trump-requests-security-clearance-son-law-jared-kushner-n684491 "Donald Trump Requests Security Clearance for Son-in-Law Jared Kushner"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161116034157/http://www.nbcnews.com/politics/politics-news/donald-trump-requests-security-clearance-son-law-jared-kushner-n684491 |date=November 16, 2016 }} NBC, Politics, November 15, 2016 Kushner was reportedly an influential factor behind the firing of New Jersey governor [[Chris Christie]] as head of the transition team, as well as the dismissal from the Donald Trump transition team of anyone connected to Christie.{{cite web |title=Trump Transition Shake-Up Part of 'Stalinesque Purge' of Christie Loyalists |url=http://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2016-election/trump-transition-shake-part-stalinesque-purge-christie-loyalists-n684081 |newspaper=NBC News.com |date=November 15, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161115151719/http://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2016-election/trump-transition-shake-part-stalinesque-purge-christie-loyalists-n684081 |archivedate=November 15, 2016 }}{{cite web |title=Why Mike Rogers' Departure from the Trump Team Alarming |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/blogs/post-partisan/wp/2016/11/15/why-mike-rogerss-departure-from-the-trump-team-is-alarming |newspaper=The Washington Post |date=November 15, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161116150108/https://www.washingtonpost.com/blogs/post-partisan/wp/2016/11/15/why-mike-rogerss-departure-from-the-trump-team-is-alarming/ |archivedate=November 16, 2016 }} An anonymous source familiar with the transition told ''Politico'', "Jared doesn't like Christie... He's always held [the prosecution of his father] against Christie."{{cite web |url=http://www.politico.com/story/2016/11/donald-trump-team-rivals-231277 |title=Trump team rivalries spark infighting |publisher=[[Politico]]|access-date=November 21, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161118212223/http://www.politico.com/story/2016/11/donald-trump-team-rivals-231277 |archivedate=November 18, 2016 }} Kushner told ''Forbes'' that the reports that he was involved in Christie's dismissal were false: "Six months ago, Governor Christie and I decided this election was much bigger than any differences we may have had in the past, and we worked very well together... I was not behind pushing out him or his people."Steven Bertoni, [https://www.forbes.com/sites/stevenbertoni/2016/11/22/exclusive-interview-how-jared-kushner-won-trump-the-white-house/ Exclusive Interview: How Jared Kushner Won Trump The White House] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161122135145/http://www.forbes.com/sites/stevenbertoni/2016/11/22/exclusive-interview-how-jared-kushner-won-trump-the-white-house/ |date=November 22, 2016 }} ''Forbes'', November 22, 2016 === Senior Advisor to the President === [[File:President Trump's First 100 Days- 69 (33573171263).jpg|thumb|Kushner during the April 2017 [[2017 Shayrat missile strike|Syrian missile strike]] operation]] On January 9, 2017, Kushner was named [[Senior Advisor to the President of the United States|Senior Advisor to the President]]{{cite press release |last=Trump |first=Donald J. |date=January 9, 2017 |title=President-Elect Donald J. Trump Names Jared Kushner Senior Advisor to the President |url=http://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/ws/?pid=120984 |location=N.Y.C. |publisher=[[Presidential transition of Donald Trump|GreatAgain]] |quote=Trump today announced Jared Kushner will serve as Senior Advisor to the President... Kushner, a widely respected businessman and real estate developer was instrumental in formulating and executing the strategy behind President-elect Trump's historic victory... |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170622181821/http://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/ws/?pid=120984 |archivedate=June 22, 2017 }} (formally, "Assistant to the President and Senior Advisor"{{cite web |title=Executive Office Of The President Annual Report To Congress On White House Office Personnel White House Office As Of: Friday, June 30, 2017 |url=https://www.whitehouse.gov/sites/whitehouse.gov/files/docs/disclosures/07012017-report-final.pdf |work=White House |page=15 |accessdate=June 30, 2017 |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20170630223857/https://www.whitehouse.gov/sites/whitehouse.gov/files/docs/disclosures/07012017-report-final.pdf |archivedate=June 30, 2017 |deadurl=no |format=[[PDF]]}}). He consequently resigned as CEO of Kushner Companies, and as publisher of the ''Observer''.{{Cite web|url=http://www.businessinsider.com/jared-kushner-steps-down-as-publisher-of-the-observer-2017-1|title=Trump Son-in-Law Jared Kushner Will Step Down as Publisher of the Observer, and Have No 'Ownership Stake'|last=McAlone|first=Nathan|date=January 9, 2017|website=[[Business Insider]]|archive-url=https://archive.is/20170512112415/http://www.businessinsider.com/jared-kushner-steps-down-as-publisher-of-the-observer-2017-1|archive-date=May 12, 2017|dead-url=no|access-date=January 28, 2017|df=}} Kushner's appointment was questioned on the basis of a 1967 anti-[[nepotism]] law.{{Cite web |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/post-politics/wp/2017/01/09/tumps-son-in-law-jared-kushner-expected-to-join-white-house-as-a-senior-adviser/ |title=Trump's son-in-law, Jared Kushner, to join White House as senior adviser; no formal role for Ivanka Trump |website=The Washington Post|access-date=January 25, 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170124065829/https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/post-politics/wp/2017/01/09/tumps-son-in-law-jared-kushner-expected-to-join-white-house-as-a-senior-adviser/ |archivedate=January 24, 2017 }} On January 20, 2017, the [[United States Department of Justice|Department of Justice]] [[Office of Legal Counsel]] issued an opinion stating, "The President may appoint relatives to his immediate staff of advisors."{{Cite web |url=https://nypost.com/2017/01/21/doj-trump-hiring-kushner-doesnt-violate-anti-nepotism-laws/ |title=DOJ: Trump hiring Kushner doesn't violate anti-nepotism laws |last=Short |first=Aaron |date=January 21, 2017 |website=New York Post|access-date=January 25, 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170131081013/http://nypost.com/2017/01/21/doj-trump-hiring-kushner-doesnt-violate-anti-nepotism-laws/ |archivedate=January 31, 2017 }}Koffsky, Daniel L. (January 20, 2017). "[https://www.justice.gov/sites/default/files/olc/opinions/attachments/2017/01/20/2017-01-20-anti-nepo-stat-who_0.pdf Application of the Anti-Nepotism Statute to a Presidential Appointment in the White House Office] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170123023730/https://www.justice.gov/sites/default/files/olc/opinions/attachments/2017/01/20/2017-01-20-anti-nepo-stat-who_0.pdf |date=January 23, 2017 }}". Retrieved January 25, 2017 Kushner was sworn in on January 22, 2017.{{Cite web |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/post-politics/wp/2017/01/22/trump-pence-preside-over-east-room-ceremony-to-swear-in-senior-staff/ |title=Trump, Pence preside over East Room ceremony to swear in senior staff |website=The Washington Post|access-date=January 25, 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170122211959/https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/post-politics/wp/2017/01/22/trump-pence-preside-over-east-room-ceremony-to-swear-in-senior-staff/ |archivedate=January 22, 2017 }} {{as of|2018|February|15|df=US}}, Kushner had not obtained a full [[security clearance#United States|security clearance]] and had been operating on a temporary security clearance for more than a year,The Hill, February 15, 2018, [http://thehill.com/homenews/administration/374093-government-watchdog-group-files-complaint-to-revoke-kushner-security Government watchdog group files complaint to revoke Kushner security clearance] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180216143941/http://thehill.com/homenews/administration/374093-government-watchdog-group-files-complaint-to-revoke-kushner-security |date=February 16, 2018 }}[https://www.vox.com/policy-and-politics/2018/2/13/17003550/rob-porter-trump-kushner-security-clearance Trump's White House has a major security clearance problem] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180216085007/https://www.vox.com/policy-and-politics/2018/2/13/17003550/rob-porter-trump-kushner-security-clearance |date=February 16, 2018 }} which has given him access to classified information, until he was granted permanent access in May 2018.{{cite web|url=http://www.foxnews.com/politics/2018/05/23/jared-kushner-has-full-security-clearance-restored.html|title=Jared Kushner receives full security clearance|first=Elizabeth|last=Zwirz|date=May 23, 2018|accessdate=June 2, 2018|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180529021203/http://www.foxnews.com/politics/2018/05/23/jared-kushner-has-full-security-clearance-restored.html|archivedate=May 29, 2018}} On February 27, 2018, White House Chief of Staff [[John F. Kelly|John Kelly]] downgraded Kushner's interim security clearance to "secret" status, along with other White House staffers working with interim security clearances.{{cite web |publisher=RT |title=Jared Kushner's security clearance downgraded – reports |accessdate=February 27, 2018 |url=https://www.rt.com/usa/419984-jared-kushner-security-clearance/ |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180228013852/https://www.rt.com/usa/419984-jared-kushner-security-clearance/ |archivedate=February 28, 2018 }}{{cite web |author=POLITICO |title=Kushner loses access to top-secret intelligence |accessdate=February 27, 2018 |url=https://www.politico.com/story/2018/02/27/jared-kushner-security-clearance-downgrade-427178 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180227204509/https://www.politico.com/story/2018/02/27/jared-kushner-security-clearance-downgrade-427178 |archivedate=February 27, 2018 }}{{cite web February 11, 2017. April 5, 2017. On August 24, 2017, Kushner traveled to [[Israel]] to talk to Prime Minister [[Benjamin Netanyahu]]. He then traveled to [[State of Palestine|Palestine]] to meet President [[Mahmoud Abbas]] in an attempt to restart a peace process in the [[Middle East]].{{cite web |url= http://www.foxnews.com/world/2017/08/24/white-house-envoy-jared-kushner-begins-mideast-peace-push.html |title=White House envoy Jared Kushner begins Mideast peace push |date= August 24, Furthermore, after Donald Trump became President-elect, Kushner and his wife met with Japanese Prime Minister and other Japanese officials, while his wife was conducting a licensing deal between her namesake clothing brand and a Japanese government-owned company.{{cite web |last1=Garcia |first1=Feliks |title=Ivanka Trump's meeting with the Japanese prime minister looks even worse now |archivedate=February 4, 2017 }} His wife sat in on a meeting between her father, then-President-elect Donald Trump, and Japan's Prime Minister, [[Shinzo Abe|Shinzō Abe]].{{cite web |url=http://fortune.com/2016/12/05/ivanka-trump-donald-trump-japan-shinzo-abe/ |title=Ivanka Trump Had Business at Stake When She Met Japan's Prime Minister |deadurl=no also given the new role of leading the "White House Office of American Innovation",{{cite web |last1=Firozi |first1=Paulina |title=Kushner to lead White House innovation office: report |url=http://thehill.com/homenews/administration/325869-kushner-to-lead-white-house-innovation-office-report |website=TheHill |accessdate=March 27, 2017 |date=March 26, 2017 |deadurl=no |url=https://techcrunch.com/2017/03/26/trump-to-create-white-house-office-for-american-innovation-to-be-headed-by-kushner/ |website=TechCrunch |accessdate=March 27, 2017 |deadurl=no }} where Kushner reportedly has been focusing on improving governmental efforts with regard to [[Veterans Affairs]], [[information technology|information-technology]] contracting, and the [[opioid crisis]].{{cite web |url=http://time.com/4800796/the-trials-of-jared-kushner/ |title=The Trials of Jared Kushner |first=Karl |last=Vick |website=Time |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170601144749/http://time.com/4800796/the-trials-of-jared-kushner/ |archivedate=June 1, 2017 }} Kushner was involved in the sale of $100+ billion of arms to [[Saudi Arabia]], and during a meeting with Saudi officials at the White House, he called [[Lockheed Martin]] CEO [[Marillyn Hewson]] to ask for a lower price on a radar system to detect ballistic missiles.{{cite web |last1=Schmitt |first1=Mark |last2=Landler |first2=Eric |last3=Apuzzo |first3=Matt |title=$110 Billion Weapons Sale to Saudis Has Jared Kushner's Personal Touch |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2017/05/18/world/middleeast/jared-kushner-saudi-arabia-arms-deal-lockheed.html |accessdate=May 27, 2017 |work=[[The New York Times]] |date=May 18, 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170527011344/https://www.nytimes.com/2017/05/18/world/middleeast/jared-kushner-saudi-arabia-arms-deal-lockheed.html |archivedate=May 27, 2017 }} Kushner's business activities in [[China]] have drawn scrutiny for mixing government with business.{{cite web |url=https://www.npr.org/2017/04/25/525598501/watchdog-group-sees-conflicts-in-jared-kushners-vast-wealth-responsibilities |title=Watchdog Group Sees Conflicts in Jared Kushner's Vast Wealth, Responsibilities |last=Overby |first=Peter |date=April 25, 2017 |publisher=NPR |quote=By Democracy 21's analysis, Kushner faces two huge conflict-of-interest hurdles... The legal hurdle involves China... The federal conflict-of-interest laws cover not only Kushner's own holdings but also his spouse's holdings — in this case, trademarks and other business activities in China. |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170504085311/http://www.npr.org/2017/04/25/525598501/watchdog-group-sees-conflicts-in-jared-kushners-vast-wealth-responsibilities |archivedate=May 4, 2017 }}{{cite web |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2017/05/08/us/politics/kushner-china-visa-eb-5.html |title=Kushner Family Stands to Gain From Visa Rules in Trump's First Major Law |first1=Eric |last1=Lipton |first2=Jesse |last2=Drucker |date=May 8, 2017 |work=The New York Times |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170509060940/https://www.nytimes.com/2017/05/08/us/politics/kushner-china-visa-eb-5.html |archivedate=May 9, 2017 }}{{cite web |url=https://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2018/01/29/jared-kushner-is-chinas-trump-card |title=Jared Kushner Is China's Trump Card |author=Adam Entous and [[Evan Osnos]] |date=January 29, 2018 |website=[[The New Yorker]] |access-date=January 25, 2018 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180125002554/https://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2018/01/29/jared-kushner-is-chinas-trump-card |archivedate=January 25, 2018 }} Kushner's investments in real estate and financial services have also drawn controversy for conflicts of interest.{{cite web |last1=Drucker |first1=Jesse |last2=Lipton |first2=Eric |last3=Haberman |first3=Maggie |title=Trump's Family Still Benefiting from Businesses |newspaper=The New York Times |page=1 |date=April 1, 2017 |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2017/03/31/us/politics/ivanka-trump-and-jared-kushner-still-benefiting-from-business-empire-filings-show.html |quote=Ivanka Trump and Jared Kushner ... will remain the beneficiaries of a sprawling real estate and investment business, ... according to ethics filings... The filing ... does not provide information on his business partners or lenders to his projects. His real estate firm has borrowed money from the likes of Goldman Sachs... |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170508223906/https://www.nytimes.com/2017/03/31/us/politics/ivanka-trump-and-jared-kushner-still-benefiting-from-business-empire-filings-show.html |archivedate=May 8, 2017 }}{{cite web |url=http://nymag.com/daily/intelligencer/2017/05/report-jared-kushner-failed-to-disclose-stake-in-startup.html |title=Jared Kushner Reportedly Failed to Disclose Stake in Start-up |first=Jen |last=Kirby |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170505032452/http://nymag.com/daily/intelligencer/2017/05/report-jared-kushner-failed-to-disclose-stake-in-startup.html |archivedate=May 5, 2017 }} In May, the ''Wall Street Journal'' reported that he had failed to disclose all required financial information in his security clearance applications, including that he owes $1 billion in loans.{{cite web |last1=Bondarenko |first1=Veronika |title=Jared Kushner didn't disclose business ties to George Soros, Peter Thiel, and Goldman Sachs, or that he owes $1 billion in loans |url=http://www.businessinsider.com/jared-kushner-ties-george-soros-goldman-sachs-peter-thiel-1-billion-loan-2017-5 |website=Business Insider |accessdate=May 2, 2017 |date=May 2, 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170502174455/http://www.businessinsider.com/jared-kushner-ties-george-soros-goldman-sachs-peter-thiel-1-billion-loan-2017-5 |archivedate=May 2, 2017 }} Abbe Lowell, the lawyer of Kushner, in a statement admitted that Kushner used private e-mail for official White House business. No classified or privileged information was used on this account. Kushner's father-in-law repeatedly criticized his opponent [[Hillary Clinton]] for her [[Hillary Clinton email controversy|personal e-mail usage in her role as Secretary of State]].{{Cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-us-canada-41382495 |title=Kushner used private email account |date=September 25, 2017 |work=BBC News|location=US & Canada |access-date=September 25, 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170925001605/http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-us-canada-41382495 |archivedate=September 25, 2017 }}[[File:Embassy Dedication Ceremony (28279991058).jpg|thumb|Dedication ceremony of the [[Embassy of the United States, Jerusalem|Embassy of the United States]] in Jerusalem, May 2018]] ==== FIRST STEP Act ==== Kushner helped to spearhead creation of the [[Formerly Incarcerated Reenter Society Transformed Safely Transitioning Every Person Act]] (FIRST STEP ACT, {{USBill|115|HR|5682}}) and its May 9, 2018 endorsement by the [[House Judiciary Committee]].{{cite web|url=https://judiciary.house.gov/press-release/house-judiciary-committee-approves-bill-to-reform-the-federal-prison-system/|title=House Judiciary Committee Approves Bill to Reform the Federal Prison System – House Judiciary Committee|accessdate=June 2, 2018|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180614194458/https://judiciary.house.gov/press-release/house-judiciary-committee-approves-bill-to-reform-the-federal-prison-system/|archivedate=June 14, 2018}}{{cite web|url=https://www.cnn.com/2018/05/09/politics/prison-reform-house-judiciary/index.html|title=House panel advances bill to improve US prisons|first=Eli Watkins,|last=CNN|accessdate=June 2, 2018|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180519130550/https://www.cnn.com/2018/05/09/politics/prison-reform-house-judiciary/index.html|archivedate=May 19, 2018}}{{cite web|url=https://www.washingtonexaminer.com/washington-secrets/jared-kushner-scores-first-major-bipartisan-deal-for-trump-in-congress|title=Jared Kushner scores first major bipartisan deal for Trump in Congress|date=May 10, 2018|accessdate=June 2, 2018|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180529182059/https://www.washingtonexaminer.com/washington-secrets/jared-kushner-scores-first-major-bipartisan-deal-for-trump-in-congress|archivedate=May 29, 2018}} ==== Russian investigation ==== {{Main|Russian interference in the 2016 United States elections|Trump Tower meeting}} Kushner has said he had four meetings with Russians during the 2016 campaign and [[Presidential transition of Donald Trump|presidential transition]], and says that none of [[Links between Trump associates and Russian officials|those Russian contacts]] were improper.{{cite news|url=http://www.nbcnews.com/politics/white-house/jared-kushner-says-i-did-not-collude-foreign-governments-n785831|title=Jared Kushner Says 'I Did Not Collude' With Any Foreign Government|last=Jamieson|first=Aliestair|date=July 24, 2017|work=[[NBC News]]|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170724110016/http://www.nbcnews.com/politics/white-house/jared-kushner-says-i-did-not-collude-foreign-governments-n785831|archivedate=July 24, 2017|deadurl=no}} To hold his position in the Trump administration, Kushner is required to obtain and keep a top-secret security clearance, which, among other things, has required him to fill out "Standard Form 86: Questionnaire for National Security Positions".{{cite web |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/americas/jared-kushner-donald-trump-jr-russia-meeting-government-lawyer-dirt-hillary-clinton-a7844366.html |title=Jared Kushner 'did not know subject of Russia meeting as he did not read to bottom of email' |website=The Independent |first=Rachael |last=Revesz |date=July 16, 2017 |accessdate=July 17, 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170716230645/http://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/americas/jared-kushner-donald-trump-jr-russia-meeting-government-lawyer-dirt-hillary-clinton-a7844366.html |archivedate=July 16, 2017 }}{{cite web |url=https://www.gsa.gov/portal/forms/download/116390 |website=[[gsa.gov]] |title=Form: SF86 Questionnaire for National Security Positions |date=December 20, 2010 |accessdate=July 17, 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170712032121/https://gsa.gov/portal/forms/download/116390 |archivedate=July 12, 2017 }} Kushner's initial SF-86 form did not disclose any meetings with foreign government officials, and Kushner did not personally verify the correctness of the information on his form. As such, Kushner failed to disclose that he had met in December 2016 with Russian officials, including Ambassador Kislyak and [[Sergei Gorkov]], chairman of a Russian government-owned bank, [[Vnesheconombank]] (VEB).{{cite news |last1=Becker |first1=Jo |last2=Rosenberg |first2=Matthew |title=Kushner Omitted Meeting With Russians on Security Clearance Forms |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2017/04/06/us/politics/jared-kushner-russians-security-clearance.html |accessdate=May 26, 2017 |work=[[The New York Times]] |date=April 6, 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170526123301/https://www.nytimes.com/2017/04/06/us/politics/jared-kushner-russians-security-clearance.html |archivedate=May 26, 2017 }} Former White House Press Secretary [[Sean Spicer]] has stated that Kushner met with Gorkov briefly as part of his role in the transition, and as a diplomatic conduit to the [[United States Department of State|State Department]].{{cite web |last1=Pavia |first1=Will |title=Kushner's Kremlin connection focus |url=http://www.theaustralian.com.au/news/world/the-times/jared-kushner-named-as-person-of-interest-in-russia-probe/news-story/bd81a5a645f7138c6ad8f30fbffe5d80 |accessdate=May 26, 2017 |work=The Australian |date=May 25, 2017}} However, VEB has stated that Gorkov met with Kushner on a private matter concerning his family's real estate corporation, Kushner Companies, even though VEB has been under [[International sanctions during the Ukrainian crisis#Third|international sanctions since July 2014]].{{cite web |last1=Dilanian |first1=Ken |last2=Alexander |first2=Peter |last3=Kube |first3=Courtney |title=Jared Kushner under FBI scrutiny in Russia probe, say officials |url=http://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/jared-kushner-now-under-fbi-scrutiny-russia-probe-say-officials-n764826 |accessdate=May 26, 2017 |publisher=NBC News |date=May 25, 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170525234146/http://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/jared-kushner-now-under-fbi-scrutiny-russia-probe-say-officials-n764826 |archivedate=May 25, 2017 }} In April 2017, it was reported that Kushner's lawyer has called the omission from his security clearance form an oversight.{{Cite web |url=http://www.mediaite.com/online/rep-ted-lieu-jared-kushner-lied-and-his-security-clearance-should-be-revoked/ |title=Rep Ted Lieu: Jared Kushner 'Lied And His Security Clearance Should Be Revoked' |website=''mediaite.com'' |access-date=April 16, 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170416221541/http://www.mediaite.com/online/rep-ted-lieu-jared-kushner-lied-and-his-security-clearance-should-be-revoked/ |archivedate=April 16, 2017 }} In July 2017, media reported that for his security clearance, Kushner had recently filed a revised version of the form disclosing his contact with foreign nationals, and that it was via this disclosure that government officials first learned of the June 2016 [[Trump campaign–Russian meeting]] and Kushner's role in it. Failure to disclose such contacts can cause revocation of a security clearance, while knowingly doing so can result in imprisonment.{{cite web |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2017/07/08/us/politics/trump-russia-kushner-manafort.html |website=The New York Times |title=Trump Team Met With Lawyer Linked to Kremlin During Campaign |first1=Jo |last1=Becker |first2=Matt |last2=Apuzzo |first3=Adam |last3=Goldman |date=July 8, 2017 |accessdate=July 17, 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170711022210/https://www.nytimes.com/2017/07/08/us/politics/trump-russia-kushner-manafort.html |archivedate=July 11, 2017 }} In June 2016, an agent of [[Emin Agalarov]] reportedly offered [[Donald Trump Jr.]], Kushner's brother-in-law, compromising information on [[Hillary Clinton]] from the Russian government if he met with a lawyer connected to the Kremlin.{{cite web |last1=[[Matt Apuzzo]] |last2=[[Jo Becker]] |last3=[[Adam Goldman]] |last4=[[Maggie Haberman]] |title=Trump's Son Heard of Link To Moscow Before Meeting — Russian Government Sought to Help Father and Hurt Clinton, Email Suggested |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2017/07/10/us/politics/donald-trump-jr-russia-email-candidacy.html |accessdate=July 11, 2017 |work=[[The New York Times]] |date=July 11, 2017 |page=A1 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170711011045/https://www.nytimes.com/2017/07/10/us/politics/donald-trump-jr-russia-email-candidacy.html |archivedate=July 11, 2017 }} [[Trump campaign–Russian meeting|A meeting took place on June 9, 2016]], and included Kushner, Trump Jr., and [[Paul Manafort]], who was then chairman of the presidential campaign, who met with [[Natalia Veselnitskaya]] at [[Trump Tower]].{{cite web |last1=[[Jo Becker]] |last2=[[Matt Apuzzo]] |last3=[[Adam Goldman]] |title=Trump Team Met Russian Offering Dirt on Clinton — Key Time in Campaign — Account Shows an Inner Circle Open to Using Foreign Help |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2017/07/09/us/politics/trump-russia-kushner-manafort.html |accessdate=July 11, 2017 |work=[[The New York Times]] |date=July 10, 2017 |page=A1 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170711011757/https://www.nytimes.com/2017/07/09/us/politics/trump-russia-kushner-manafort.html |archivedate=July 11, 2017 }} According to [[Rinat Akhmetshin]], who was also present at the meeting, Veselnitskaya claimed to have evidence of "violations of Russian law by a Democratic donor", and that the "Russian lawyer described her findings at the meeting and left a document about them with Trump Jr. and the others".{{cite web |last1=Rosalind S. Helderman |last2=Tom Hamburger |title=Russian American lobbyist was present at Trump Jr.'s meeting with Kremlin-connected lawyer |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/russian-american-lobbyist-was-present-at-trump-jrs-meeting-with-kremlin-connected-lawyer/2017/07/14/1b96f25a-68aa-11e7-9928-22d00a47778f_story.html |accessdate=July 14, 2017 |newspaper=The Washington Post |date=July 14, 2017}} The [[Democratic National Committee cyber attacks]] were revealed later that week. In December 2016, U.S. intelligence officials who were monitoring Kislyak reportedly overheard him relaying to Moscow a request from Kushner to establish a "secret and secure communications channel" with the Kremlin using Russian diplomatic facilities. Kislyak reportedly was "taken aback by the suggestion of allowing an American to use Russian communications gear at its embassy or consulate – a proposal that would have carried security risks for Moscow as well as the Trump team".{{cite web |last1=Nakashima |first1=Ellen |last2=Entous |first2=Adam |last3=Miller |first3=Greg |title=Russian ambassador told Moscow that Kushner wanted secret communications channel with Kremlin |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/national-security/russian-ambassador-told-moscow-that-kushner-wanted-secret-communications-channel-with-kremlin/2017/05/26/520a14b4-422d-11e7-9869-bac8b446820a_story.html |accessdate=May 27, 2017 |work=[[The Washington Post]] |date=May 26, 2017 |quote=Ambassador Sergey Kislyak reported to his superiors in Moscow that Kushner, son-in-law and confidant to then-President-elect Trump, made the proposal during a meeting on Dec. 1 or 2 at Trump Tower, according to intercepts of Russian communications that were reviewed by U.S. officials. Kislyak said Kushner suggested using Russian diplomatic facilities in the United States for the communications. |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170527001215/https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/national-security/russian-ambassador-told-moscow-that-kushner-wanted-secret-communications-channel-with-kremlin/2017/05/26/520a14b4-422d-11e7-9869-bac8b446820a_story.html |archivedate=May 27, 2017 }}{{cite web |last1=Haberman |first1=Maggie |last2=Mazzetti |first2=Mark |last3=Apuzzo |first3=Matt |title=Kushner Is Said to Have Discussed a Secret Channel to Talk to Russia |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2017/05/26/us/politics/kushner-talked-to-russian-envoy-about-creating-secret-channel-with-kremlin.html |accessdate=May 27, 2017 |work=[[The New York Times]] |date=May 26, 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170527034930/https://www.nytimes.com/2017/05/26/us/politics/kushner-talked-to-russian-envoy-about-creating-secret-channel-with-kremlin.html |archivedate=May 27, 2017 }} In July 2017, Kushner appeared before both the [[House Intelligence Committee|House]] and [[Senate Intelligence Committee|Senate]] intelligence committees in closed session as part of their investigations into Russian meddling in the 2016 election.{{cite web |url=http://abcnews.go.com/Politics/jared-kushner-agrees-house-intelligence-committee/story?id=48776109 |title=Jared Kushner agrees to appear before House Intelligence Committee |date=July 21, 2017 |publisher=ABC News |accessdate=December 2, 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171203224453/http://abcnews.go.com/Politics/jared-kushner-agrees-house-intelligence-committee/story?id=48776109 |archivedate=December 3, 2017 }} He also released a public statement.{{cite web |url=https://www.npr.org/2017/07/24/539022904/jared-kushner-s-statement-to-congress-about-russia-annotated |title=Jared Kushner's Statement To Congress About Russia, Annotated |date=July 24, 2017 |publisher=NPR |accessdate=December 2, 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171129171922/https://www.npr.org/2017/07/24/539022904/jared-kushner-s-statement-to-congress-about-russia-annotated |archivedate=November 29, 2017 }} In October 2017 the [[Senate Judiciary Committee]] requested numerous documents from Kushner. Kushner's attorneys gave the committee many documents on November 3, but the committee followed up on November 16 with a request for many additional documents it said had not been produced.{{cite web |url=http://www.businessinsider.com/senate-judiciary-committee-jared-kushner-document-request-2017-11 |title=The Senate Judiciary Committee sent Jared Kushner a big request for documents he has refused to provide |last=Smith |first=Allan |date=November 16, 2017 |work=Business Insider |accessdate=December 2, 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171203224430/http://www.businessinsider.com/senate-judiciary-committee-jared-kushner-document-request-2017-11 |archivedate=December 3, 2017 }} In early November 2017, Kushner was interviewed by investigators from Special Counsel [[Robert Mueller]]'s office. Reportedly the interview focused on former National Security Advisor [[Michael Flynn]].{{cite web |url=https://www.cbsnews.com/news/jared-kushner-interviewed-special-counsel-robert-mueller/ |title=Jared Kushner interviewed by special counsel's office |last=Martinez |first=Peter |date=November 29, 2017 |publisher=CBS News |accessdate=December 2, 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171203074613/https://www.cbsnews.com/news/jared-kushner-interviewed-special-counsel-robert-mueller/ |archivedate=December 3, 2017 }} On December 1, Flynn pleaded guilty to one count of lying to the FBI, as part of a plea bargain. ''Bloomberg'' reported that Kushner is most likely the "senior member of the Trump transition team," mentioned in Flynn's plea documents, who is said to have ordered Flynn to contact Russia.{{cite web |url=https://www.bloomberg.com/view/articles/2017-12-01/kushner-is-said-to-have-ordered-flynn-to-contact-russia |title=Kushner Is Said to Have Ordered Flynn to Contact Russia |date=December 1, 2017 |publisher=Bloomberg L.P. |access-date=December 1, 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180101103257/https://www.bloomberg.com/view/articles/2017-12-01/kushner-is-said-to-have-ordered-flynn-to-contact-russia |archivedate=January 1, 2018 }} Mueller is investigating meetings between Trump associates including Kushner and [[George Nader (businessman)|George Nader]], an emissary representing the crown princes of the [[United Arab Emirates]] (UAE) and [[Saudi Arabia]]. In August 2016, Nader offered help to the Trump presidential campaign."[https://www.nytimes.com/2018/05/19/us/politics/trump-jr-saudi-uae-nader-prince-zamel.html Trump Jr. and Other Aides Met With Gulf Emissary Offering Help to Win Election] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180613204813/https://www.nytimes.com/2018/05/19/us/politics/trump-jr-saudi-uae-nader-prince-zamel.html |date=June 13, 2018 }}". ''The New York Times''. May 19, 2018. In December 2016, Nader attended a New York meeting between the United Arab Emirates officials and Kushner, Michael Flynn and Steve Bannon.Shimon Prokupecz, Kara Scannell and Sara Murray [https://edition.cnn.com/2018/03/06/politics/george-nader-robert-mueller/index.html 'Man of mystery' cooperates with Mueller in Russia probe] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180612140959/https://edition.cnn.com/2018/03/06/politics/george-nader-robert-mueller/index.html |date=June 12, 2018 }} CNN, March 7, 2018 Mueller is also investigating Kushner's possible ties to [[Qatar]], [[Israel]] and [[China]].{{cite web |title=It's Not Just a "Russia" Investigation Anymore |url=https://slate.com/news-and-politics/2018/03/mueller-investigation-spreads-to-qatar-israel-uae-china-turkey.html |work=Slate |date=March 8, 2018 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180609055955/https://slate.com/news-and-politics/2018/03/mueller-investigation-spreads-to-qatar-israel-uae-china-turkey.html |archivedate=June 9, 2018 }} Kushner's contacts with Russian officials have come under scrutiny as part of the larger federal investigation into [[Russian interference in the 2016 United States elections|Russian interference in the election]].{{cite web |last1=Keneally |first1=Meghan |title=Scrutiny of Jared Kushner's Russia contacts brings the probe to Trump's inner circle |url=http://abcnews.go.com/Politics/scrutiny-jared-kushners-russia-contacts-brings-probe-trumps/story?id=47657212 |accessdate=May 27, 2017 |publisher=ABC News |date=May 26, 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170526185943/http://abcnews.go.com/Politics/scrutiny-jared-kushners-russia-contacts-brings-probe-trumps/story?id=47657212 |archivedate=May 26, 2017 }} He had two undisclosed phone calls with the Russian ambassador, [[Sergey Kislyak]], between April and November 2016. His attorney, [[Jamie Gorelick]], told Reuters that he had participated in "thousands of calls in this time period" and did not recall any with Kislyak.{{cite web |last1=Parker |first1=Ned |last2=Landay |first2=Jonathan |title=Exclusive: Trump son-in-law had undisclosed contacts with Russian envoy – sources |url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-trump-fbi-kushner-exclusive-idUSKBN18N018 |accessdate=May 27, 2017 |agency=[[Reuters]] |date=May 27, 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170527005840/http://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-trump-fbi-kushner-exclusive-idUSKBN18N018 |archivedate=May 27, 2017 }} ==Personal life== [[File:President Trump's Trip Abroad (34784285005).jpg|thumb|right|Kushner with Ivanka, [[Melania Trump]], and [[Saudi Arabia]]'s Crown Prince [[Mohammad bin Salman]] in May 2017]] Kushner has a younger brother, [[Joshua Kushner|Joshua]], and two sisters, Dara and Nicole.{{cite web|url=https://www.vanityfair.com/news/2017/09/jared-kushner-family-empire-observer|title=How Jared Kushner Is Dismantling a Family Empire|last=Cohen|first=Rich|magazine=Vanity Fair|date=September 27, 2018}} He married [[Ivanka Trump]] in a Jewish ceremony on October 25, 2009. They had met in 2005 through mutual friends.{{cite web |last1=Sherman |first1=Gabriel |title=Ivanka Trump on New Fiancé Jared Kushner: 'He'll Be a Great Father' |url=
